name: diff
content:
diff noun
(DIFFERENCE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ S ] informal short for
difference : OK, I'm stupid. What's the diff between an en-dash and a hyphen?
More examplesFewer examplesVery few people know it's not genuine. Tourists, especially, can't tell the diff. The price of the hotel room makes a big diff if you are using it to work or staying a few days.Yam, sweet potato, what's the diff ?Previous results meant England had the better goal diff, and could progress with a draw.

diff noun
(COMPUTING)
[ C or U ]
  computing
  specialized a computer program that can show the differences between computer files: A diff of the two files will show the sequences that are invalid. You can use the "diff" command to show differences between two files, or each corresponding file in two directories.
More examplesFewer examplesInstead of using diff to compare the current password file with the saved version, the script uses comm twice.Next time you try and view a diff of .doc files, it will launch this tool and you should be able to compare them.For files that are identical, "diff" normally produces no output.

diff noun
(IN VEHICLE)
[ C ] informal short for
differential gear : The passenger seat rattled, and a wonky diff meant that in a slow right-angled turn the whole rear end juddered.
More examplesFewer examples I eventually bought an MX-5 with hard-top, limited slip diff, air conditioning and option package A for £8000.This type of noise is often from a diff and travels down the tubular propshaft to sound as if it comes from the gearbox.

short for
different : I told her that my previous salary was irrelevant because it was a totally diff job in a diff industry.
More examplesFewer examplesI went out and got a lot of credit cards for diff stores.I wanted to try at least 10 diff ways of cooking fish.I always put all of those ingredients in, just in diff quantities.
